Work on the school has been moving
along smoothly, but a major problem
recently reared its head.<sp:0:4:0>We don't have enough teachers. Symin
is interviewing people, but he hasn't
found a good fit yet.<sp:0:4:0>I'd like to hire someone intelligent,
educated, and capable of earning the
children's trust.<sp:0:4:0>Nurturing our children is an extension of
our duty to this land. We shape our future
by the way we shape their path.<sp:0:4:0>I hope to see sterling members of our

up that mantle as their teacher.
Comment_10:
After the Calamity, I asked myself how to
rebuild, and set out across Hyrule in
search of an answer.<sp:0:4:0>I saw collapsed buildings, lost cities...
The damage was far worse than I had
imagined.<sp:0:4:0>But as I watched the people and heard
their stories, I was convinced all was
not lost.<sp:0:4:0>The people's spirits were not broken.
They and their strong wills are Hyrule's
greatest treasure.<sp:0:4:0>They are the ones who will rebuild, and
my contribution to their efforts will be to
protect them while they do so.
Comment_11:
As part of Hyrule's reconstruction, we've
built a school in Hateno Village.<sp:0:4:0>It's the largest Hylian village, with its
sprawling, bountiful land.<sp:0:4:0>There are so many children living here
that it seemed the ideal place to found
a school.<sp:0:4:0>I've recruited Symin from the research
institute to teach there.<sp:0:4:0>He was Purah's assistant for years, which
makes him well-equipped to deal with the
needs of quirky children.<sp:0:4:0>I'll be overseeing the school for a while
myself to keep an eye on the students.
